Package javax.portlet.annotations

This describes a proposed extension for the JSR 362 Portlet Specification 3.0 public API to exploit CDI capabilities in portlets.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    PortletSerializable
    This interface must be implemented by PortletStateScoped beans in order to allow the bean portlet container to intialize the bean at the beginning of a request and passivate the bean at the end of the request.
    URLFactory
    Interface that allows URLs to be generated.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    PortletURLGenerationListener.URLType
    Needed for V2.0 portlets to discern between a Render URL and an Action URL since both are represented by the interface PortletURL.
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    ActionMethod
    Designates a method corresponding to the portlet API processAction method.
    ActionParam
    Qualifier that specifies an action parameter for injection.
    BeanPortlet
    Provides a qualifier sometimes needed for disambiguation.
    ContentTypeSupport
    This annotation is used within composite portlet configuration annotations to represent the portlet modes and window states supported for a given content type.
    ContextPath
    Qualifier that specifies the context root for injection.
    CustomPortletMode
    This annotation is used within composite portlet configuration annotations to represent a custom portlet mode.
    CustomWindowState
    This annotation is used within composite portlet configuration annotations to represent a custom window state.
    Dependency
    This annotation is used within composite portlet configuration annotations to represent dependencies the portlet may have on external resources.
    EventDefinition
    This annotation is used within composite portlet configuration annotations to represent a single event.
    EventMethod
    Designates a method corresponding to the portlet API processEvent method.
    HeaderMethod
    Designates a method corresponding to the doHeaders method of GenericPortlet.
    InitParameter
    This annotation is used within composite portlet configuration annotations to represent name-value pairs.
    LocaleString
    This annotation represents locale-specific strings used within composite portlet configuration annotations to represent information describing the portlet.
    Namespace
    Qualifier that specifies the namespace for injection.
    PortletApplication
    Annotation for the portlet application configuration.
    PortletConfiguration
    Annotation for the portlet configuration.
    PortletConfigurations
    Annotation for configuration of multiple portlets.
    PortletQName
    This annotation is used within composite portlet configuration annotations to represent a QName for use in portlet event and public render parameter definitions.
    PortletRequestFilter
    Designates a portlet request filter class.
    PortletResources
    Declares resources needed by one or more portlets in a portlet application.
    PortletSessionScoped
    Provides a CDI custom scope that is scoped to the portlet session rather than to the servlet session.
    PortletStateScoped
    Provides a CDI custom scope that is scoped to the portlet state.
    PortletURLGenerationListener
    Designates a portlet URL generation listener method.
    Preference
    This annotation is used within composite portlet configuration annotations to represent a single portlet preference.
    PreferencesValidator
    Designates a preferences validator method.
    PublicRenderParameterDefinition
    This annotation is used within composite portlet configuration annotations to represent a single public render parameter.
    RenderMethod
    Designates a method corresponding to the portlet API render method.
    RenderParam
    Qualifier that specifies an action parameter for injection.
    ResourceParam
    Qualifier that specifies an resource parameter for injection.
    RuntimeOption
    This annotation is used within composite portlet configuration annotations to represent portlet container runtime option name-value pairs.
    SecurityRoleRef
    This annotation is used within composite portlet configuration annotations to represent a single security role reference.
    ServeResourceMethod
    Designates a method corresponding to the portlet API serveResource method.
    Supports
    This annotation is used within composite portlet configuration annotations to specify the supported portlet modes and window states for a given locale.
    UserAttribute
    This annotation is used within composite portlet configuration annotations to represent a single user attribute.
    WindowId
    Qualifier that specifies the window ID for injection.

Package javax.portlet.annotations Description

This describes a proposed extension for the JSR 362 Portlet Specification 3.0 public API to exploit CDI capabilities in portlets.

Overview

The annotation-oriented API provides new capabilities in several areas.

  • It allows portlet configuration declarations to be performed through use of annotations. The goal is to reduce or remove the need to write a portlet deployment descriptor in most instances.

    The developer can choose between providing configuration data through annotations or through the portlet deployment descriptor. If the same type of information is provided through both annotations and the deployment descriptor, the information from the deployment descriptor has precedence.

  • It allows portlets to be written as CDI beans. Such portlets can make use of standard CDI features such as interceptors, decorators, and dependency injection.

    Bean portlet methods must carry with one of the following annotations: ActionMethod, EventMethod, HeaderMethod, RenderMethod, ServeResourceMethod, or PortletResources.

    Bean portlet methods can be contained in any valid bean class. The class needs not implement any portlet-specific interface or extend a portlet class. However, each bean portlet method has method signature requirements that must be fulfilled. Please see the annotation descriptions.

  • It provides new custom scopes for portlet artifacts.
    • Using the scope annotation PortletSessionScoped associates the bean lifecycle with the portlet session.
    • Using the scope annotation PortletStateScoped associates the bean lifecycle with the portlet state, which conceptually is stored on the URL. If you use PortletStateScoped beans, your bean state will be automatically stored as render parameters for the portlet setting the state.
  • It allows portlet artifacts such as portlet request filters, URL generation listeners, and preference validators to be implemented as CDI beans.

    Please see the following annotation descriptions: PortletRequestFilter, PortletURLGenerationListener, and PreferencesValidator.

Injectable Portlet Artifacts

In addition to the annotations, this package provides producer methods that allow many portlet artifacts to be injected into your code as beans. The following table describes the beans that are available for injection.

Note: Most of these beans are dependent on the portlet request being executed, but could not themselves be declared as @RequestScoped due to technical limitations. These beans should be used within enclosing beans that are either @PortletStateScoped or @RequestScoped to allow the portlet container to properly manage the lifecycle of the injected object. The required enclosing bean scope is noted in the table.

Object Description Enclosing Bean Scope Annotation Example
PortletConfig The PortletConfig object. Use qualifier @BeanPortlet for disambiguation. Any
@Inject @BeanPortlet
private PortletConfig portletConfig;
PortletRequest The PortletRequest object. Any
@Inject
private PortletRequest request;
PortletResponse The PortletResponse object. Any
@Inject
private PortletResponse request;
PortletPreferences The PortletPreferences object. Any
@Inject
private PortletPreferences preferences;
PortletSession The PortletSession object. Any
@Inject
private PortletSession session;
URLFactory Provides methods for creating URLs. See URLFactory. Any
@Inject
private URLFactory urlFactory;
PortletMode The PortletMode object. @RequestScoped or @PortletStateScoped
@Inject
private PortletMode mode;
WindowState The WindowState object. @RequestScoped or @PortletStateScoped
@Inject
private WindowState windowState;
Cookies[] An array of Cookies set for the portlet. See getCookies. @RequestScoped or @PortletStateScoped
@Inject
private Cookies[] cookies;
Locale The Locale object. See getLocale. @RequestScoped or @PortletStateScoped
@Inject
private Locale locale;
Locales[] An array of supported Locales for the portlet. See getLocales. @RequestScoped or @PortletStateScoped
@Inject
private Locales[] locales;

Using the @PortletStateScoped Annotation

The @PortletStateScoped Annotation allows portlet render parameters to be treated as beans. The bean state is stored as a portlet render parameter. The annotation documentation for PortletStateScoped describes the necessary prerequisites.

The paramName element in the annotation can be used to provide a parameter name for storing the bean. This element can also be left empty, in which case the portlet container will generate a parameter name.

When resource URLs are generated, @PortletStateScoped beans valid for the current request are automatically stored on the URL as render parameters. When creating render or action URLs, @PortletStateScoped beans can be automatically stored on the URL with the state valid for the current request by using the appropriate option with the URLFactory createActionURL and createRenderURL methods.

However, you might want to set a modified @PortletStateScoped bean value on your URL. You can do this using the PortletURL interface setBeanParameter method. You can create a new bean, set the fields as desired, and use the setBeanParameter method to set the new bean on the URL.

Tip: It might be useful to provide your @PortletStateScoped bean with a copy constructor in addition to the required default constructor. You could then create a new @PortletStateScoped bean based on the current state of the injected bean and then update the fields on the new bean as required.
